strats.name: Leave with Runway, Tube Not Broken
strats.devNote: FIXME: Needs a way to represent that this runway has an 'air' environment.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Suitless)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Gravity)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Suitless, Top Position)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Suitless, Bottom Position)
Come In Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Tube Not Broken)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Bottom Position)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Top Position)
Carry G-Mode Morph Through Tube
devNote: Bomb jumping across the broken tube uses a second bomb to climb up to the tube.
FIXME: Moving before the bomb explodes gives enough momentum to only need one power bomb.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Tricky Cross Room Jump
note: Only requires a runway of 1 tile in the adjacent room.
This strat is slightly easier on the right side at low run speeds, but the same otherwise.

strats.name: Cross Room Speedy Jump
note: Only requires a runway of 7 tiles in the adjacent room, but an extra tile makes for an easier jump.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Gravity, HiJump)
G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Gravity Jump
note: In direct G-Mode, the tube will break once Samus moves after exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.
In indirect G-Mode, Samus must exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb explodes.
Either way, it is recommended to exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb goes off to be safe.
Jump as the first action to gravity jump to the top of the room.
Note that the door will be closed, so open it during the ascent. This can only be attempted once.

blocks.note: The Moat, Double Chamber, Wrecked Ship Energy Tank Room

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
strats.note: The tube will break when exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Gravity Jump
note: In direct G-Mode, the tube will break once Samus moves after exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.
In indirect G-Mode, Samus must exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb explodes.
Either way, it is recommended to exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb goes off to be safe.
Jump as the first action to gravity jump to the top of the room. This can only be attempted once.
devNote: This could be useful as a way to unlock the top door for later, if there is no normal way to climb the room.
FIXME: Strats to unlock door 4 from 6 need to be added.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Gravity, HiJump)
Come In Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Gravity, Wall Jump)
Come In Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Suitless, HiJump, Bottom Position)
Come In Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Suitless, HiJump, Any Position)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Gravity, HiJump)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Gravity)
Carry G-Mode Morph Through Tube, Bomb Into Spring Ball Jump
note: Pause and jump just before the fade out finishes. Turn off Spring Ball and place a Bomb just above where Samus' head would be if standing.
Pause again between 23-25 frames later and equip Spring Ball; Samus has a three frame window where she has upward momentum from the Bomb and can jump again.
The positioning of the Bomb is quite lenient, with an 11 frame window for where it can be placed.
This must be done twice to climb the room.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Door Lock Skip
devNote: Though there is no door shell here, the bypassesDoorShell is included for completeness in case a randomizer adds a door shell where bypassing it could be useful.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.

strats.note: The tube will break when exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.

strats.name: Cross Room Platform Stuck Wiggle to Top Door

requires.notable: Cross Room Platform Stuck Wiggle to Top Door

note: Requires a runway of at least 18 tiles in the adjacent room.
Ride up the right wall just above the doorway, then turnaround before and after hitting the platform following the doorway slope.
Continue up the rest of the way to reach the door.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
note: Assumes a runway of at least 21 tiles in the adjacent room.
End Samus' momentum where no platforms are over head.
Shoot the door while rising to pass through.

devNote: FIXME: This (and other cases) can leave with enough vertical momentum to make it to the middle door of Main Street,
if the top door of Maridia Tube connects to the bottom of Main Street.

note: This applies to Statues Hallway and Baby Kraid Room.
This applies to Bowling Alley (middle, power off) and Basement (power on).

strats.name: Tricky Grapple Jump Through Door (Any Position)

blocks.note: Climb Supers Room, Bubble Mountain, Lava Grapple Tunnel

devNote: Opening a Missile door while grapple jumping is tricky but possible.

strats.name: Tricky Grapple Jump Through Door (Right Position)
Grapple Teleport into Grapple Jump or Tube Intact (Lower Entrance)

requires.notable: Grapple Teleport into Grapple Jump (or Tube Intact)

note: Swing to the right, shoot open the door above, and grapple jump through it.
The grapple beam will need to be retracted while swinging to the right, to avoid bonking on the small platform.
devNote: FIXME: Add a version of this with an exit condition for grapple jumping through the transition.
FIXME: Add a canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess variation coming from Moat, which only works if door is not blue.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Gravity Jump
note: In direct G-Mode, the tube will break once Samus moves after exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.
In indirect G-Mode, Samus must exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb explodes.
Either way, it is recommended to exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb goes off to be safe.
Jump as the first action to gravity jump to the top of the room. This can only be attempted once.
devNote: This could be useful as a way to unlock the top door for later, if there is no normal way to climb the room.
FIXME: Strats to unlock door 4 from 6 need to be added.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Inside Wall
note: After teleporting, retract Grapple by pressing up.
Then if necessary, wiggle right out of the wall by turning around a few times.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb 1 screen to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
devNote: This strat is only useful if the room were modified to have a door lock on the left.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge
devNote: FIXME: Passing through the Toilet is possible but tricky and may have certain momentum requirements, in addition to probably needing a down-back or turnaround.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
devNote: FIXME: for sparking in top position, it would help to model being able to enter spinning;
for now, extra shinecharge frames are included to compensate.
FIXME: Passing through the Toilet is possible but tricky and may have certain momentum requirements, in addition to probably needing a down-back or turnaround.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Through Tube
strats.note: If the tube is unbroken, this requires a tunnel crawl or unmorph at the top right of the tube in order to clip down through it.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Carry G-Mode Through Tube
strats.note: If the tube is unbroken, this requires unmorphing at the top right of the tube in order to clip down through it.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge
devNote: FIXME: Passing through the Toilet is possible but tricky and may have certain momentum requirements, in addition to probably needing a down-back or turnaround.

strats.name: Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
devNote: FIXME: for sparking in top position, it would help to model being able to enter spinning;
for now, extra shinecharge frames are included to compensate.
FIXME: Passing through the Toilet is possible but tricky and may have certain momentum requirements, in addition to probably needing a down-back or turnaround.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Through Tube
strats.note: If the tube is unbroken, this requires a tunnel crawl or unmorph at the top right of the tube in order to clip down through it.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Carry G-Mode Through Tube
strats.note: If the tube is unbroken, this requires unmorphing at the top right of the tube in order to clip down through it.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Gravity Jump
note: In direct G-Mode, the tube will break once Samus moves after exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.
In indirect G-Mode, Samus must exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb explodes.
Either way, it is recommended to exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb goes off to be safe.
Be sure not to overload PLMs with the camera scroll blocks which are next to the tube.
Jump as the first action to gravity jump to the top of the room.
Note that the door will be closed, so open it during the ascent. This can only be attempted once.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
note: The tube will break once Samus moves after exiting G-Mode or when the Power Bomb finishes detonating, whichever is later.
Be sure not to overload PLMs with the camera scroll blocks which are next to the tube.
It is possible to exit G-Mode before the Power Bomb goes off to be safe.

strats.name: Breaking the Tube Gravity Jump
note: Jump as the first action after breaking the tube to gravity jump to the top of the room.
Open the door and go through it during the ascent. This can only be attempted once.

strats.name: Break the Tube with a Power Bomb
Suitless Spring Ball
strats.note: Unmorph at the top of the jump to touch the transition. A crouch jump can help.

strats.name: Tube Intact
strats.note: Until the tube is broken there is no water in this room.

strats.name: Breaking the Tube Gravity Jump (From Above)
note: Jump as the first action after breaking the tube to gravity jump back up and out of the door.
This can only be attempted once.
strats.devNote: Any type of door can be unlocked, because it can be done before breaking the Tube.

strats.name: Break the Tube with a Power Bomb
Unmorph Tube Clip
strats.note: Unmorph once fully underneath the rightside slope to clip.

strats.name: Morphless Tube Clip
note: Wedge Samus under the right side slope with either a very clean low jump or tunnel crawl movements.
Once deep enough, the clip will happen automatically.

strats.name: Unlock the Top Door
strats.devNote: If 4 is locked, strats that go to 4 can't exit at 4, but they can drop to 6 and unlock the door.

notables.name: Tube Clip
note: Clip into the Maridia Tube from above without needing to break the tube.
This can be done with morph by unmorphing under the sloped tiles on the right, or with canTunnelCrawl by wedging Samus under them with a precise low jump and then performing a tunnel crawl.

notables.name: Grapple Teleport into Grapple Jump (or Tube Intact)
note: Swing to the right, shoot open the door above, and grapple jump through it.
The grapple beam will need to be retracted while swinging to the right, to avoid bonking on the small platform.

notables.name: Cross Room Platform Stuck Wiggle to Top Door
note: Requires a runway of at least 18 tiles in the adjacent room.
Ride up the right wall just above the doorway, then turnaround before and after hitting the platform following the doorway slope.
Continue up the rest of the way to reach the door.

notables.name: Breaking the Tube Gravity Jump
note: Jump as the first action after breaking the tube to gravity jump to the top of the room.
Open the door and go through it during the ascent. This can only be attempted once.
